text: We used the CEACAM classification proposed by Beauchemin et al. (1999) [27] and Kammerer et al. (2007) [22] . If an orthologous relationship to human proteins could not be defined, the proteins were denoted by the generic gene name in the GenBank. In nonmammalian species, all CEACAM family genes were annotated with a Roman letter based on their chromosomal localization.
